history.content: I've been looking, and I don't see a specific page or word count either. What I know is that most of the people who read these will have been reading a ton of other applications, so you don't want to make it excessively long. If you can keep it around one page each, that's great. If you have something extraordinary that you want to say that takes longer, then do that. But think carefully if you're planning to go long. What are you going to write that will make your ideas stand out for your readers from the rest of the essays that they're going to read that day?

children.subject: IIRC, there wasn’t a limit last year. I kept both of mine to under 2 pages single-spaced, FWIW, although I have no idea if that’s recommended.

At most a page for personal history statement, and at most two pages for statement of purpose 

Word count wise, keep the first under 500 words and the second between 500-1000 words

I have no insight for the 5th year MS program in particular, these are just the guidelines I followed for my grad apps ^

history.content:
The Graduate Division has this guide to writing the Personal Statement and this guide to writing the Statement of Purpose published. I found it to be pretty helpful while composing my application. 

I don't think there are strict word limits for either, but it's always good to be succinct.
Anyone has any idea on the word count for these two essays? They just said "upload a file" without mentioning the word count or page number. Is there anywhere I can find the information?
history.subject: Statement of Purpose & Personal History Statement for 5th year MS
